faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.description: Clear answers to common questions about our services and approach.

items.question: How does press relations work?
items.answer: We work to build and strengthen your public image through strategic media placements, journalist relationships, and relevant content production. Each strategy is customized according to your goals and profile.

items.question: Do you handle crisis situations?
items.answer: Yes, we offer crisis management with swift and strategic action. Our team is prepared to respond within 24 hours, protecting your image and reputation in critical moments.

items.question: What is the Reputation Repair service?
items.answer: It's a specialized service for removing negative content from the internet and recovering digital reputation. We use legal and ethical techniques to restore your online image.

items.question: How does visa advisory work?
items.answer: We offer complete support for visa processes, including integrated media strategy that strengthens your professional profile and increases approval chances.

items.question: How long until I see results?
items.answer: Timelines vary by service and objectives. Press relations typically shows results in 30-90 days, while crisis management has immediate response. We present a detailed timeline in the proposal.

items.question: Do you guarantee confidentiality?
items.answer: Absolutely. Confidentiality is one of the pillars of our work. All clients and projects are treated with complete discretion and professional secrecy.

items.question: Do you serve clients outside São Paulo?
items.answer: Yes, we serve clients throughout Brazil and abroad. Our approach is adapted to meet the specific needs of each region and market.

items.question: How is pricing determined?
items.answer: After an initial conversation to understand your needs, we present a customized proposal with scope, timeline, and investment. We don't work with generic packages.

faq.cta: Still have questions? We're ready for a conversation.
